website_summaries.verdict: Decent overall value and performance, but potential buyers should note it's designed primarily for users of average size.
pros: Features foam grips along with multiple stabilizing pads for added comfort and support on most surfaces
cons: Lacks an adjustable dip width, which can be an issue for users outside of the average size range

customer_reviews.title: This is very sturdy, relatively cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy, relatively cheap, is very versatile, and is easy to put together. My only complaints are that one of the base studs was bruised/scratched from the shipping(It's not noticeable anyway because of their black color), and that you will need a thin screwdriver to screw the bases together as you have to screw them on through these small holes that connect over the base of the stand. Also be advised that it is somewhat wide. If you have narrow shoulders and a thin build you might want to buy a narrower stand (This is not adjustable).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done for a relatively cheap price, but issues with quality don't seem to be uncommon
customer_reviews.text: The product works as intended as one of the cheaper options for those looking for a dip setup, but the quality control on the parts doesn't seem too great which can lead to sub par sturdiness/feel (seems to be an issue in many recent reviews as well). It is cheaper than other options, but it may be more worthwhile to spend more for a more consistent/sturdy product if you really need something sturdy and issue free. As a note, I had one piece that wouldn't fit in and I had to contact them for a replacement piece. Fortunately, they responded and acted quickly, but the replacement piece still suffered from some issues but allowed for the product to be usable.
customer_reviews.author: Val A.

customer_reviews.title: My only qualm is that it is not 100% sturdy. I have messed with and re-done the pads ...
customer_reviews.text: This is very well built, and does what it is supposed to do. I am 6'1, and am able to do dips, leg raises, and body weight rows, all with a little bit of room to spare. My only qualm is that it is not 100% sturdy. I have messed with and re-done the pads on the bottom, but I still occasionally get a wiggle, more when I am doing rows. It is minimal, and I am able to live with it. overall, a great product to add to your home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Micki Free is Not a Girl

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not quite mint condition
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice dipping station, I use it several times a week. I only have one real gripe and that was that the unit arrived, lovingly shrouded in bubble-wrap and carefully held in place with zip ties and yet the poles had quite a number of scrapes going all of the way through the paint and a tear on one of the foam rubber grips. It would seem that the factory is a rough place before the parts arrive to the tender loving care of the people who pack them into their boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Watsin Aneighm

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: It works for what it's meant to. I haven't had any problems with it, which is nice because I was a bit skeptical it was going to be big enough for me (I'm 6'3" 190 lbs). The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star review is because where the bars connect, isn't stable. I assembled the product just as the instructions guided me to do so and have tightened the bolts a million times, but no matter how much I tighten the bolts the left arm is still wobbly. It seems that the socket was made to big, so it doesn't fit tightly to the base of the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Simpson

customer_reviews.title: unstable but cheap price
customer_reviews.text: it is a cheap product so I do not want to claim too much but when I assembled this one, each hinge part was not quite tight and closely connected one another. there was quite large gap between two bars and the connecting part with screws. So far, I used it from time to time, but the unstable shaking move from the bars, it made me stay away from using this product. sorry to give just 2 stars but it deserved :(
customer_reviews.author: kyuyeong choi

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: You have to wonder about the QA/QC at this place. The box came nearly destroyed, there were some scratches on the metal, and the pads that came with it wouldn't fit because the pieces were out of tolerance. Looking at the screw holes,there was gunk in and around most of them. I now see why the price dropped so much - maybe all they have left are items that have already been returned and they are trying to see which schmuck will just take defective equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Good stand at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dip stand to do dips (go figure) and inverted rows. The product is of solid construction and the plenty tall enough for me, I'm 5' 9". I saw other reviews that said the product wasn't that stable and it wobbled after it was built. I did not have this issue. In order to get this stand as sturdy as possible, fasten all the metal pieces together and then tighten each screw and then tight the opposite screw on the unit. When I did this, the stand was completely solid. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for a quality dip/inverted row stand.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole 2384

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I owned and liked the older model which is only 4 pieces. The new model that I received January of 2018 is 6 pieces that is held together by about 25-30 bolts. I was unable to secure the bolts enough to keep it from wobbling, no matter how tight the bolts were made. The tubing on both models were strong. I sent the new model back. I'd reorder if I could guarantee I was getting the older 4 piece version.
customer_reviews.author: Nic E

customer_reviews.title: Great dip set! - Get it.
customer_reviews.text: Great dip set for the money. This completes my home work out center and provides an alternate way to hit my upper pecs and triceps effectively. Unlike some others I have no problem with the width of the set even though a nice plus would be for future design to incorporate more of an angular forward pointing "V' setup for the grip area. This would allow the user to have variation in width of grip. That would move this set to a FIVE STAR. The set was well packaged and easy to put together. If you are thinking about one of these, for the price you cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: 1 Man Army

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but clips that hold it together a dodgy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy but clips that hold it together a dodgy. So the drilling of the holes as everyone else has said is definitely not lined up properly so you have to kind of jam the two parts together and it works and for me it doesn’t move around once you’ve done that but it’s definitely not a good design
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Use electric tape like teflon tape to cure wobbles.
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews I've read seem valid. I all but cured the wobble by using electric tape as a plumbers teflon wrap on the connectors. Just two wraps on the tapered end of the male pieces will seal the gaps creating the wobble. Note the base connectors at the centers had the most wobble, they may need more attention. It's not a perfect fix, but it does the job with a little force and patience. You may want to try a little grease over the connections once the tape is applied and turn the unit so the male side inserts downward into the connection using gravity and body weight for leverage.
customer_reviews.author: TJG

customer_reviews.title: Looked like someone took it apart Willy Molly and threw it ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this would absolutely be a 5 star review. However do NOT purchase through amazon warehouse. Read previous reviews where they were missing parts and though oh their luck maybe I will score. Nope. Bag of all the screws, and bolts not in a bag just scattered through the bottom. Missing pieces that connect it together. Looked like someone took it apart Willy Molly and threw it in the box for garbage. I did call the manufacture. Even though they sent me a replacement part it wasn’t the right part. Spend the 20-30 bucks extra for a new one. Or buy it directly from black mountain.
customer_reviews.author: danny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home gym
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as an addition to my home gym to be able to do dips. It was easy to assemble and is really sturdy. It doesn’t flex at all when I use it and there is minimal wobbling. The grips are easy to hold and comfortable for your hands. It has been a solid purchase even after a few years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jlrrx2206

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Item was discounted for 29.99 and was a steal. Product is very strong and stable. Directions are easy to follow and having tools included helped. The length between each handle is perfect for doing Dips and Chest Dips. I am recommended this product to anyone who wants a dip station or has thought about building their own.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: When i got it the sinde of the pipes were rusty and the instruction was a bit off (The foam box thingy. It says foam side down and screw from the top but u have to insert the screw from the foam side..) also the top part and the bottom part of the box doesnt really match even with the screws tightly put on. Also there were some scratches on the bars it self, my roommate thought they sent me a refurbished one. But ive tried it and it does the job. 3 stars because the presentation was terrible but like i said it does what its suppose to do (so far..)
customer_reviews.author: Jongin Choi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, the foam handles on the bars were damaged. They are still functional but it’s disappointing to buy something new and have it arrive messed up. The square stabilizers/stands for the bottom of the stands are flimsy and the female end of the screw (that’s glued in) ripped off during assembly. You don’t really need the stabilizers if you are using the stands on carpet and overall they are sturdy and do the job. You get what you pay for. Just keep in mind you may be resigned to using these on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a good product and works great for triceps
customer_reviews.text: Its a good product and works great for triceps, pecs and other muscles but i only use it for chest and triceps. The dip bar feels solid and safe. Assembling it was pretty easy and the only reason i gave it 4 stars is that while assembling it i noticed that the foam pads that keep it from sliding on the floor were put on the wrong plastic pieces. I had to switch them with the parts that had the company label. If you buy it and find that you cant screw the bottom pieces together you can send it back or you can mcgyver it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not quite there but workable.
customer_reviews.text: Ah, where to begin. My first piece of advice for BMP is to hit up their QA person in China. The carriage bolts are inconsistent AND none of the nuts actually fit over the threads of the bolts. Also please change the picture of the screws for the stabilizers to match what you’re shipping because it just looks like a mistake. In the meantime I’m gonna go to Lowe’s and see if I can find some nuts that fit over these bolts to correct this rickety mess.
customer_reviews.author: BMc

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly solid piece of equipment and simple construction. Holds my weight just fine at 205lbs and perfect height for me, 6'3" Does not sway, creak or give under pressure. Perfect spacing between handles. 4/5 as I noticed the foam padding on grips is a bit weak. Easy to tear but easy to fix with some gaffers tape. Otherwise it's worth the money. If the male to female tubing connections are a bit wobbly just use some electrical tape on the maile end before sliding in to tighten the fit. Does not impair use.
customer_reviews.author: Techvania

customer_reviews.title: Showed up defective
customer_reviews.text: The stand came with a defective foot block rendering it unable to be even attatched properly. I can only attach screws into 3 of the 4 slots on one of the blocks. Will update review if I get a replacement block, until then I suppose I'll run it with only 3 of the screws in. In the pictures below the problem appears to be the gold fitting that the screws go into, one of them is cut and half, with half in one block, half in the other.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: It’ll work
customer_reviews.text: Upfront id day the dip bar I purchased will work and accomplish what I need. I’m 5’ 10” and can use it with a weight belt. However as soon as I opened it, there were noticeable scrapes and gouges in some of the pieces. Additionally the screw housing for the floor pieces began coming apart as I attached them. Poor craftsmanship but it’ll work for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marcela A.

customer_reviews.title: Would rank this higher if hardware was of higher quality
customer_reviews.text: Solid enough to do what it's supposed to do (300 lbs. is realistic, certainly not capable of 3000 lbs.) The hardware however is really cheap. I twisted one of the carriage bolts in half just by snugging it down with a 3/8" ratchet. Also, one of the screws in the feet pulled lose when securing it with a screwdriver. Easy to remedy, but would like better bolts etc. But again, once put together you can do dips on it with no wobbling or flexing.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Poor Qualiry Concerns
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. I would not advise anyone to buy it. I bought this item for my son and as we were putting it together on Christmas Day, we abruptly couldn’t go any further because the holes where the screws go to secure the top and the bottom bars, were not aligned. They don’t have a person that does quality checks? Absolutely absurd and heart breaking. It would be nice if they would replace this piece with one that has been checked before shipping with holes that align. Do the right thing please.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Dip Station!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this dip station. The seller was great too! I had a part that wasn't clipping on properly because the screw couldn't catch and they sent me a replacement part, no problem! I highly recommend these folks.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Get this one
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Ultimate Body dip stand first thinking they both have good reviews and the more expensive one would be somehow better. Ultimate Body one was absolute garbage. I returned it and got this one instead. This one is cheaper and 1000% better quality. I'm 6'1'' and 185lbs and feel very secure. I knocked one star off because one of the bolts snapped while tightening it. They did send a replacement right away. A very good buy overall.
customer_reviews.author: Cabby

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, stable, solid
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, stable, solid. What more can you ask from such a simple piece of equipment? Well, my particular stand happened to have a defective bolt, but I got a replacement from the hardware store for $0.50 since I already had it mostly assembled when I figured out there was a problem. I'll keep the 5 star rating, since I've never had a problem doing product exchanges through Amazon, and it was my decision not to do so this time. I'm sure that if I had done a product exchange everything would have been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sedmak

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a little wide
customer_reviews.text: A great product for those of us wanting to work on arms and chest (I personally got this equipment to work on the lower part of my pectorals), but as others have pointed out the distance between the bars makes it a little hard to do dips using correct form. I can still do dips, but it took me a few weeks to get into the swing of things with it. It's a solid product, relatively easy (if not a little frustrating - screwing can get monotonous) to put together and it's a great price, but it's not perfect, at least for my build.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product/Excellent transaction!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product and transaction 5 stars for the following reasons: a. The order arrived before I anticipated it - BIG b. easy assembly c. The dip stand performs EXACTLY as I was hoping it would. Sturdy, no wobble, easy to move around. I would recommend this to ANY friend or family member of mine that was in the market.
customer_reviews.author: a. Syverson

customer_reviews.title: A good, compact dip stand - I recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm working on building up my home fitness program after downsizing and moving. I enjoyed using the dip station on my Pacific Fitness home gym, but alas, I had to sell it after 25 years. The Black Mountain dip stand is a good replacement. It takes up very little space and I can use it in my low ceiling basement. Now I need to find a pull up bar that will work on my low doorways. Anyway, I recommend this unit for anyone who wants to build up their chest and triceps.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Great product for great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid. Very durable. Very affordable. Kind of wide for small person but good for men or perhaps tall women. The hand-holds are relatively wide apart. Overall a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged and flawed
customer_reviews.text: The threading inside the bars is flawed, preventing the bars from being joined without a lot of unnecessary effort. The holes for the bolts are not threaded wide enough either. Had to widen with my electric drill. Mine has marks all over the black painted bars as if it were used already; specifically where the 4 not slip pads should go having paint scraped off at the time of unboxing. Disappointing but after a few alterations, will work as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical because the price was so low, but this purchase was well worth the price. It's very stable, high enough for me (6'1"tall) to do dips with weights without touching the floor. the feet are very nice, padded on one side so you could use this on a hardwood floor without damaging the finish. The grips for your hands are also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Miller

customer_reviews.title: Read this first!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I'll just start with for the price it's ok my main problem with this equipment is the stabilizer squares. They are riddled with problems. The molds that they are pulled from leave lots of plastic left over so getting a proper fit around the tube isint going to happen easily and in trying to do so you will most likely pull out the screw inserts when tightening them together. Quality control must of taken a day off during the inspection of the stabilizer squares. All in all it does what it's supposed to. I'm sure the stabilize squares will be the first thing to go on this.
customer_reviews.author: Josh huls

customer_reviews.title: Blown away
customer_reviews.text: I have reviewed a couple different products and used the words "sturdy" or "rigid". All of those things were nice, but this dip stand is strikingly sturdy! This dip station is also very sleek and definitely not an eye sore. This station comes with a no nonsense one page of instructions that are decidedly easy to follow (there isn't much to put together). The only thing that could have possibly made this product better, is if there were marked spots for where exactly the pads were to be installed, but that is honestly a very small gripe.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good Product Bad Delivery
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is amazing and i highly recommend getting it! But with that being said this came to me scratched up and dented and it seems like the feet for the base of the dip station were not cut right so the placement is off. If these things were not an issue this would easily get a 5 star review
customer_reviews.author: Austin Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works for 6' man
customer_reviews.text: This thing is STURDY. BMP makes quality stuff and this is no different. And they are so friendly, I got a slightly damaged part in my shipment, I asked them how I could repair it, and the person on the other end said, "No worries, we will send out a replacement part today." Awesome. I am 6'2" tall and this is the perfect width for me, and height. I can dip all the way down, touch my knees, and that gives me more than a full range of motion on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.text: Great dip bar that took me about 5 minutes to put together. My son does a number of exercises on it and is incredibly sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.author: NewHopeBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The bar on one side wobbles terribly. Makes it really hard to do dips correctly. I read a lot of reviews on here saying this product was very sturdy, and maybe this is just a quality control issue, but mine is not sturdy at all. I put it together correctly, and I had a friend double check it to see if I was missing something, but they couldn't find anything wrong with the way it was put together. The padding for your hands is really nice, and the construction feels fine other than the wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and totally unusable
customer_reviews.text: Horrible and totally unusable. Had it fully assembled, everything tightened and it was the shakiest most unstable thing I've ever seen. It could rock a solid 4 inches in either direction. Bought it right before a move so I didn't assemble until well outside of the return policy. Ended up disassembling and dropping it off at Goodwill. Maybe someone could weld the pieces together and actually get some use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Smelly Randy

customer_reviews.title: stability is important!
customer_reviews.text: Why make something so well and add cheap things to save money? Mine wobbles.. drives me crazy.. dont feel like returning it because i really wanted a dip bar.... maybe mine came bent i dont know but the stabilizing blocks are cheap and a few screws just ran and never caught hold to tighten properly... They also clearly state " stabilizing pads for any surface" it barely has any padding at all ! So 3 stars because other than that it is strong and comfortable to hold..
customer_reviews.author: uncle al

customer_reviews.title: This is the pest!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was some bull.... Serous I thought it was. But its solid as it says. The thing is harder than all my furniture. The cushion on the handles don't slide or the pads for feet. And leaning in for lower chest is no prob. It will not tip. Try, u will see.... I would give it a 6 out of 5 but its impossible. Worth mor than it cost!! (Don't raise the price though lol)
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Works way better than the first bar I ordered from another company. The length is perfect for doing dips (and I'm a small guy, only 5'7) Unfortunately the plastic "feet" are poor quality, they strip and break easily. But they are not needed in order for the product to work, so I didn't take off a star. All in all I'm happy with the performance so far. I hang gymnastic rings on mine for added exercises and use.
customer_reviews.author: Sniper-Nighthawk

customer_reviews.title: Don't WASTE YOUR TIME!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product, terrible manufacturing, not sturdy or stable. Spent an hour right after work putting this together and after securing all screws and bottom stabilizers in place, the Top portion of the stand shakes from side to side. THIS IS THE MOST IMPORTANT ASPECT TO DOING DIPS. IF THE BARS ARE NOT STABLE, ITS A WASTE OF TIME. IMMEDIATELY RETURNED THE ITEM. WAITING ON REFUND. Thanks for wasting my time.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Works just as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for something to take on vacations and other times away from home. It's solid (only tried it on carpet so far) and holds plenty of weight. Great for dips and Australian pull ups when you don't want to go to a gym. It may not be assembled and disassembled in seconds, but it's no great hardship either. I"m just over 6 feet tall, and I can hang a 45 lb plate from my waist without issue. It was originally going to be for away from home purposes, but it will replace my primary DIY dip stand now. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: My main concern was, is this thing going to shake & wobble? Nope. Very stable, took about 15 minutes to set up, has rubber feet, so it won't scratch wooden floors. It works great, and they shipped it fast too!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Pacini

customer_reviews.title: Use your own gear to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. But I would go an buy your own nuts, bolts, and washers for the assembly. I am guessing that I slightly over tightened one of the bolts and it now free spins in the nut. Now it has a slight wobble in and outward. It will need to be cut out an put a new one in so it stops that. Get your own gear for assembly guys and make sure everything is tight, otherwise it will not be real sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy design and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy design and versatile. I continue to do dips, leg raises, bicycles, and inverted rows. Also have used it to stretch hamstrings and perform assisted pistol squats. Glad I got this and a doorway pullup bar rather than a power-tower.
customer_reviews.author: citizenmav787

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy dip stand & great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dip stand for my 18 year old son. He's 6' 2" and weighs 175. He really likes the versatility of this stand. After he found the correct tools to assemble it, the stand is very sturdy and solid. We were missing about 3 screws, so I called Black Mountain's customer service and they mailed me a complete set asap. They are very friendly & helpful. I have purchased their products in the past and always find them to be professional and will do whatever is necessary to please their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This bar is very strong and works as expected. I read a couple of reviews about the joints wobbling slightly and slight cosmetic damage. Both were true in my case, but each is minor and does not affect the quality of the device when using it; therefore I did not dock any stars. Note that they did offer me a free yoga mat to write a review, but they did not require anything other than my opinion. Maybe you can get a free yoga mat too when you buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Simply inoperable
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. Holes would not align. Impossible to assemble. Such a simple design that it is unbelievable it got screwed up by the manufacturer. It's obvoous no one pre-assembles these to make sure they fit together correctly...
customer_reviews.author: J. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Simple construction that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super durable and is great for dips. The only things I don't like about it are: it doesn't fold up or collapse to be able to easily move it out of that way if necessary, it doesn't sit flush on the ground so it wobbles a bit when I'm using it. The height off the ground is perfect in my opinion. I'm about 6' tall - if that helps anyone make a decision.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dip station to develop triceps strength (I'm a Judo player). It is working very well! The station is really sturdy and somewhat easy to assemble (some parts need a little push or pull to align the holes for screws and bolts). It is very convenient for a small apartment (at least in my case). I use it for dips, inverted rows, incline push-ups and leg raises. Really a good investment for people who want to develop strength using bodyweight only.
customer_reviews.author: Satho

customer_reviews.title: Good Dip Stand
customer_reviews.text: Received BMP Dip stand today. It was easy to assemble. Great to have this as part of my home gym. Giving 4 stars out of 5 just because the 4 stabilizer square blocks at the bottom have really sharp edges. I did get a minor scratch/cut on my feet. You have to be careful while standing near it. I wish the manufacturer had made the stabilizer round instead of square to avoid sharp edges. I hope they read this feedback and make the necessary changes for future customers. Overall, a nice product that does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: My wife is not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Item came scratched up missing parts and hardware missing! My wife is not happy. I received a replacment unit and quality is god aweful the base pads rip the screws out very easily and holes dont line up. I will return product for refund.
customer_reviews.author: CR Alltech

customer_reviews.title: Black Mountain Dip Station
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give five stars however, I had to give this product a four star rating; when I do explosive dips my screws come loose and I have to tighten with my fingers. The one thing I would change about this dip station is to make the pieces lock together Instead of using nuts and bolts that are difficult to tighten. Other than the loose bolts it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Laturno

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: By far a great purchase for my husband. He loves it. Super sturdy and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: TinaR.

customer_reviews.title: On sale for $30, I was pleasantly surprised by how quality the product feels.
customer_reviews.text: Got on sale for $30 Feels/looks quality Would have given 5 stars but the bars kind of wiggle when you aren't applying pressure to them. This doesn't impact the functionality/safety just having that flex makes it feel less quality. Would give 4.5 if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I read a review on this before I bought it and I will have to agree that the distance between the bars might be a little wide for smaller FEMALES, which I am. I have not been able to dip as low as I want, for that reason. However, the exercises I'm doing call for using this in other ways, such as pullups (from underneath) and laying it on it's side for modified pushups, and it has been fine for those. Other than that, I believe it is a very well-made product and was easily assembled and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Paddeelynn

customer_reviews.title: Thanks .
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice product . But I had a small problem putting the handles on the main frame . Once they were on they were a little wobbly. But all and all I like this and I use every day for pushups , leg lifts and for my back .
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality/Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Was shipped fast and it’s easy to assemble. It does have a rattle and mine came bent so it is not parallel and about 2 inches height difference between sides. The holes are slightly off but it works. Not worth $50. Could shave down the stabilizing feet or put towels to even it out but it’s ghetto. It is wide set compared to parallel bars.
customer_reviews.author: Jerel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Super solid. Versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Solid. I have been using it for a range of exercises including row style pull ups and incline push ups with my feet on a chair. It's awesome. The width feels great to me. I'm a big dude at over 6ft tall so I don't know what it would be like if I were smaller but it's hard not to imagine liking this thing. It's light and feels super strong. I'm using a weight vest for added resistance and I totally trust it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Student of Life

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect condition. Excellent quality and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. Excellent quality and very sturdy. I am 6'2", the bar height is ideal for my needs. In addition to dip exercises the the bars are plenty high for reverse rows, without my back contacting the floor. Update: Awesome customer service! After about 2 years of regular use the grips split apart. I contacted the supplier, received a prompt reply and they shipped 2 new handles free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I think the [floor plastic thingies] do not really fit but even without the screws and the [floor thingies ] it works well for me once all the major pieces are connected. I feel like its pretty sturdy but I'm a short small person.
customer_reviews.author: bananasfosterwallace

customer_reviews.title: Overall I would recommend this product to anyone looking to do dips as ...
customer_reviews.text: After a little bit of research on different dip bars I decided to go with this one because it allowed for the ability to do a weighted dip and not have the weight hit the floor. Only gave it 4 stars because it could be a little more stable, however when you are doing dips there isn't any concern of it moving. Overall I would recommend this product to anyone looking to do dips as it's inexpensive and has a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ramm

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the home gym.
customer_reviews.text: I am 190lbs, 2'11 and this baby supports me without any concerns. I have tried adding a weight vest (35lbs) and a belt with hanging weights without any issues. You can a complete workout with this item if you know how to use it properly. I personally use it for chest dips, tricep dips, and back pullups. It is well built and should last a long time if taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Sykout

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother buying
customer_reviews.text: I owned an Ultimate Body Press for years. Bought the above dip station because to looked similar. Not even close to the quality I hoped for. It screws together rather then snapping into place like the Ultimate. I was missing 4 screws so had to go to Home Depot to buy them. When using it, its wobbly and unsteady. Save your money and pass on this junk
customer_reviews.author: John Ford

customer_reviews.title: My son and I love the dip bars
customer_reviews.text: My son and I love the dip bars. Very sturdy and well constructed. Very easy to put together. there is some flaking of the paint on one of the bars but it is not bad enough to want to return.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: + Very sturdy, heavy-duty metal bars
customer_reviews.text: + Very sturdy, heavy-duty metal bars. + High grip gives plenty of dip room for me at 6'0; can also alternatively be used for vertical grip inverted rows and has a wide, stable enough base for tucked rows. - Parts come in a flat box zip-tied together; four months later the impressions from the zip-ties are permanently dented into the foam handles which overall feel "deflated" and squared off from tight packaging, even where zip-ties weren't used. The foam protects you from cold metal but not much else. +/- Doesn't sit flush on a hardwood floor; rocks like a chair with an uneven leg, but flattens out once bodyweight is loaded. Minor annoyance, may bother you, may not.
customer_reviews.author: ethigenetic

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy to put together but the stabiler block feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy easy to put together but the stabiler block feet the screw threads pop out the base unless you place them in the outer four corners smaller diameter sides of the piping
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good product, would recommend as a standalone dip station.
customer_reviews.text: Super rugged, rated for 3k pounds. Easy to assemble. Wish it was somewhat adjustable. If you already have a rack, I would buy an attachment that can connect to your rack for dips...usually those are adjustable and cheaper. Very short or very tall people may want to try something else as this station isn't adjustable. I'm pretty average height and it works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately one of the sleeves/couplers was not installed into the wrong end and it doesn't look like it's going to come out without a blow torch ...
customer_reviews.text: Product came partially assembled from the factory. Unfortunately one of the sleeves/couplers was not installed into the wrong end and it doesn't look like it's going to come out without a blow torch or something. Not worth my time to try and fix it, too cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Moare

customer_reviews.title: Not a good case. Costa Rica
customer_reviews.text: Product is aweful in details: 1.The tube came totally fold, Top and Botton cannot be assemble 2.The holes for the Top and Botton are not aligned, so the crews are not passing by It’s a shamed, I wanted it so much, I even took it to Costa Rica, Sorry guys, but not a good product in my case
customer_reviews.author: carlosmongefernandez

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I've been diagnosed with sciatica, I have to make my back and core stronger and this has helped with that
customer_reviews.author: Deseree' Jean Shuler

customer_reviews.title: Build Quality is ok
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars but one bolt had to be hammered in because the holes did not match. Its is not evenly flushed on the ground. It stands on 3 of the 4 stands and seesaws back and forth which is distracting. Besides that it is a good product and feels sturdy with 260 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Does what its supposed to do. Just its a little wobbly from one of the attachments and had some scratches already
customer_reviews.author: Joel O.

customer_reviews.title: iwould have loved it if it was just 3-5 inches closer
customer_reviews.text: i might be on the small end (5'7 170lbs) but it seemed the handles are just a bit to far apart for me that going full range of motion puts too much stress on my shoulder, iwould have loved it if it was just 3-5 inches closer together
customer_reviews.author: ESH

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this dip stand and am very impressed. It's well constructed and does exactly what's promised. Putting it together took some minor twisting of the uprights to get the lag screws through, and a hammer wrapped in a rag to get the holes lined up vertically, but that was a minor inconvenience. Now that it's together I've used it for dips, some suspended abdominal exercises and inverted pushups. It's well worth what I paid for it and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ive used it and very much like it. this is perfect for me to start ...
customer_reviews.text: Ive used it and very much like it. this is perfect for me to start working out at home and especially to strengthen my arms. the material seems pretty sturdy, i've had family try it out and they all like it.
customer_reviews.author: LarryBmx

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, high quality product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality product at a reasonable price. Timely shipping. Highly recommend product and vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Rand Edelstein

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of exercise equipment!
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly a great and simple piece of exercise equipment! There are so many ways to use it to focus on different body parts.
customer_reviews.author: Anne K

customer_reviews.title: 👎
customer_reviews.text: When I put it together it was higher on one side than the other, it was crooked and too wide for dips.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Barker

customer_reviews.title: Looking at some of the earlier reviews, others have ...
customer_reviews.text: Looking at some of the earlier reviews, others have stated that this stand was a little wobbly. It seems they have corrected the issue with more bolts at the joints. Each connection is now connected by 4 bolts instead of one bolt. The pictures of the product are only showing the joints connected by 1 bolt. I used my impact driver to tighten up the nuts and this stand is rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: although very sturdy & heavy duty tubing
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected for quality, although very sturdy & heavy duty tubing, some of the hardware weren't even usable, the upper arm didn't even have holes to bult up on either side, the stability block were very poor quality, some broke jus from average tightening. I wouldn't recommend this product..
customer_reviews.author: Kel El

customer_reviews.title: Dip station and more.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy working on losing weight and I comfortably fit between the bars. I've had no issues with support and the device always feels stable as I use it. It was easy to assemble. Didn't look at the instructions once because it was so easy. I've been using it for dips, incline push-ups, and Australian pull-ups so it's more then just a dip station. Very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Searles

customer_reviews.title: Works but the handle foam padding was damaged on one ...
customer_reviews.text: Works but the handle foam padding was damaged on one side figured not worth returning for that but yeah. Also the stabilizers screws were kinda short so they were barely able to hold them together.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but holes misdrilled in the frame
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, but I think the holes in the frame were a little off on mine. One side was approx 3/8" higher even after taking it back apart and flipping sides. Too much of a pain to dismantle and send back so I just made a wood shim to go under the foot of the high side.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I received the stand on the date promised. The stand is very easy to put together by one person. The stand is very sturdy. I weigh over 200 lbs and do not feel uncomfortable in any way using it with all my weight on it. My son came to the house and used it and said he is going to order one for his home as well.
customer_reviews.author: Old Dog New Trick

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using the Black Mountain dip Station. It is very sturdy and assembly was pretty easy. The entire station when you lift it is heavier than it looks which I like. I'm working on getting stronger and I find when I'm doing dips on this apparatus it is quite stable. I also like how wide apart the top is. Before I was doing dips on an old Soloflex that came with an attachment for dips and stability wasn't so great. That and my hands would hurt because there was no padding on the Soloflex attachment. It doesn't take up too much space which made my wife happy as well.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.C.D.

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service. Trusted seller in my book. Would be 5 stars but even with all bolts as tight as possible the handles wobble when initially putting one’s weight on them. This is because of the way the pieces fit together... not totally snug.
customer_reviews.author: Nunyo Bidnizz

customer_reviews.title: Missing nuts and bolts
customer_reviews.text: Had to order twice. First one missing nuts and bolts
customer_reviews.author: robin solymanijam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I needed a dip stand and this works perfectly. Easy to put together. The only problem is the alignment isn't perfect. One of the holes a little off. Plus, the top tubes would be better simply bottoming out in the bottom with the screws just holding them in place. I might drill them myself to do that. As it is now they're just a LITTLE bit wobbly (the base is solid) but it's really not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Horse Parent

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing!!! Great for dips and pullups and leg raises. Once you start reps it is as stable as you are. Only complaint is that it is pretty big and will not fit through my interior doorways but fits through exterior doorways snuggly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr_HAHA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Equipment. 255 lb guy doing calistenics with confidence.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to practice planche, dips and other calisthenics and as I said, I am a big guy. Equipment has held together well with weekly use. It was easy to assemble and stays on the back porch to be used often. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, just not level
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept and it is sturdy, but mine is warped/twisted, which is a nuisance sometimes when doing weighted dips. I have to adjust it (i.e., twist on it) in between each set to try and level out the base.
customer_reviews.author: Fenian

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces. Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived without many of the pieces needed to fully assemble. I received 0 of the 4 stabilizers, 0 of the 24 carriage bolts, and 12 of the 16 sets of screws. Returns are a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together.  Didn't even need instructions!
customer_reviews.text: We just received this the other day. Shipping was fast and it actually arrived before I thought it was supposed to! We had an old one and bought this to replace it and let me just tell you the product is built with quality. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for an affordable, and durable parallel bar.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jones

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more, this one is great
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it really can’t complain. Just as good if not better than dip stations at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, COMPLETE TRASH.
customer_reviews.text: wish I could give 0 stars. The package came damaged. The screws etc were strewn about the box, mixing a screw, couple washers and nuts, holes dont line up. Save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere, this thing is complete TRASH. Im going to check out the amazon basics one now personally,
customer_reviews.author: Alexis P.

customer_reviews.title: Great For Home Workouts
customer_reviews.text: Product came just as described, in secure packaging. very simple assembly and sturdy. not sure if there is a weight limit but I'm close to 190lbs and have no issues. So far I have been using it for of course dips but also a lot of abdominal work with leg lifts and knee ups. 5/5 would highly recommend for anyone trying to get a good homework out in! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: wes

product_meta.title: Black Mountain Products Heavy Duty Stand 3000-Pound Rated Dip Station
product_meta.description: Black Mountain Products dip stand is a full steel dip station rated for 3000lbs. B.M.P's dip stand is simple to put together and easily mobile with its light weight. Each dip station comes with foam grips for ultimate comfort. Each dip station is designed with four stabilizing pads allowing the dip stand to sit level on most surfaces. Dip stands are great for building lean muscle and burning fat. They are often used for dips, rows, body pulls and much more. Having a portable dip stand allows you to train anywhere with ease. Each Black Mountain Products dip stand comes with a lifetime warranty.
